sorry.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: feeling ashamed or unhappy about something bad you have done
sorry.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: It was probably too late to say sorry, but she would try anyway.
She was genuinely sorry for what she had done.
Casey was sorry he’d gotten so angry.
sorry.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: feeling sad about a situation, and wishing it were different
sorry.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I was sorry to hear about your accident.
Brigid was always sorry she hadn’t kept up her piano lessons.
We were sorry to miss your concert.
I won’t be sorry to leave this place.
I’m so sorry about your father  (=sorry something bad has happened to him).
sorry.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: very bad, especially in a way that makes you feel pity or disapproval
sorry.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: the sorry state of the environment
It’s a sorry state of affairs when an old lady has to wait 12 hours to see a doctor.
the sorry sight of so many dead animals
This whole sorry episode (=bad thing that happened) shows just how incompetent the government has become.
sorry.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with sorry
sorry.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0: You are sorry about something bad that has happened
I’m sorry about what I said
I’m sorry about your car  (=sorry that your car has been damaged)
sorry.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1: You are sorry for the delay, the inconvenience, or the trouble
The next train will arrive in 12 minutes We are sorry for the delay
sorry.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2: You are sorry for doing something bad
sorry.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3: You are sorry that  you did something or sorry that something happened  ‘That’ can be omitted
I’m sorry that I can’t come
I’m sorry you didn’t get the job
I’m sorry for I can’t come
sorry.translation[0].note_box[0].items[4: If you are sorry to do something, it makes you sad to do it
I’ll be sorry to leave this place
I’ll be sorry for leaving this place
sorry.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: used to ask someone to repeat something that you have not heard properly
sorry.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: ‘Want a drink?’ ‘Sorry?’ ‘I said, would you like a drink?’
